perturbation.original_text: Company shall ensure that all of its personnel involved in the activities set forth under this Agreement comply with all applicable Laws and the Promotion Rules. Company shall ensure that the Sales Representatives and Other Company Employees Promote the Product at all times in accordance with applicable Laws and the Promotional Materials provided and approved by Janssen, refrain from making any false or misleading statements about the Product and refrain from discussing any unapproved uses of the Product.
perturbation.changed_text: Company shall ensure that all of its personnel involved in the activities set forth under this Agreement comply with the Promotion Rules. Company shall ensure that the Sales Representatives and Other Company Employees Promote the Product at all times in accordance with the Promotional Materials provided and approved by Janssen, refrain from making any false or misleading statements about the Product and refrain from discussing any unapproved uses of the Product.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the explicit requirement for Company personnel to comply with 'all applicable Laws.' By omitting this requirement, the contract introduces a potential legal contradiction as pharmaceutical promotion is heavily regulated, and compliance with laws is mandatory. This introduces legal risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act; Anti-Kickback Statute; False Claims Act; State consumer protection laws.

perturbation.original_text: In the event Company elects to provide incentives to Sales Representatives, such incentives will be appropriate, in accordance with the applicable Laws, and, in the aggregate, competitive in the marketplace with respect to the products promoted by the Sales Representatives.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event Company elects to provide incentives to Sales Representatives, such incentives will be, in the aggregate, competitive in the marketplace with respect to the products promoted by the Sales Representatives.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase 'appropriate, in accordance with the applicable Laws,' eliminates a critical safeguard. Sales incentive programs in the pharmaceutical industry are subject to anti-kickback statutes and other regulations. This omission creates a potential for incentives that violate these laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Anti-Kickback Statute (42 U.S.C. § 1320a-7b); Federal False Claims Act

perturbation.original_text: Company represents and warrants that it is in compliance, and covenants that it will continue to comply during the Term, with all applicable Laws, rules and regulations, including the federal anti-kickback statute (42 U.S.C. § 1320a-7b), the related safe harbor regulations, and the Limitation on Certain Physician Referrals, also referred to as the "Stark Law" (42 U.S.C. § 1395nn).
perturbation.changed_text: Company represents and warrants that it is in compliance, and covenants that it will continue to comply during the Term, with the federal anti-kickback statute (42 U.S.C. § 1320a-7b), the related safe harbor regulations.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'all applicable Laws, rules and regulations' and the 'Stark Law' (42 U.S.C. § 1395nn) weakens the compliance warranty. The Stark Law prohibits physician referrals of designated health services if the physician has a financial relationship with the entity. This makes the contract potentially non-compliant.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Limitation on Certain Physician Referrals, also referred to as the "Stark Law" (42 U.S.C. § 1395nn)
